hosting_multisite_git_association_title: Configure your Git for your {{ path }} directory
hosting_multisite_git_association_incorr: The URL is not in the correct format
hosting_multisite_git_association_ssh_ur: Enter the URL of your Git repository ({{ httpsRepo }}) or if SSH is enabled ({{ sshRepo }})
hosting_multisite_git_association_ssh_ke: Your SSH key generation failed, please try again later or contact support
hosting_multisite_git_association_apply_: Your last configuration failed. In order to configure Git, you will need to apply your configuration again.
hosting_multisite_git_association_error_: Git could not be activated {{ errorMessage }}
hosting_multisite_git_association_succes: Git is being enabled. You can track its activation from the current tasks Current tasks
hosting_multisite_git_association_ssh_br: Enter the name of the branch of your repository that will be replicated ({{ branchesNames }})
hosting_multisite_git_association_config: Configure the deployment of your files on your Git repository
Enter the address of your Git repository and the name of the branch:
HTTPS for a public repository (e.g.: https://github.com/username/)
SSH for a private repository (e.g.: git@github.com:username/)
The installation directory must be empty;
Before applying the configuration, you must add your new SSH key in your Git account settings to enable the deployment of a private repository.
hosting_multisite_git_association_webhoo: A webhook is a tool that allows Github to inform other applications when certain events occur in a Github repository.
hosting_multisite_git_association_config: Your configuration will apply to all domains pointing to your directory.
hosting_multisite_git_association_reconf: You will need to redeploy your branch for the changes to take effect
Upload URL cannot be changed. To deploy another repository to this directory, you must first delete and recreate the git configuration associated with this directory.
